text: most Berkeley soup recipes are pretty
OneNote they taste like broccoli
but this recipes Sears the broccoli dark
brown and then I leave the other side
greed and I don't cook it through you
get rich and caramelized and you also
get fresh and green there are dieting
broccoli soups this is not one of them
this is a creamy rich delicious broccoli
soup the trick here is to let it get
really Brown I'm gonna sear it in
batches one pot soup I learned about
this half searing and then leaving the
other half on the seared technique from
Andrew Feinberg from Franny's he uses it
on broccoli and he also uses zucchini
you can make the same recipe in the
summertime with fresh zucchini it's
fabulous I am gonna use water for this
recipe I'm not gonna use stock you're
gonna need to add enough salt to bring
out all the flavors
I still have some olive oil in the
bottom of the pan but I'm gonna add a
little butter butter gives this some
fabulous richness and once that melts
I'm going to add just some chopped onion
garlic lots of it a little chili flakes
now potato is optional in this recipe
but I love the way that it adds a
creaminess body to the soup the thinner
you slice your potatoes the quicker
they'll cook but you could also leave it
out you'll have something a little bit
lighter
let this cook until the potatoes are
just tender broccoli and I'm going to
continue to cook this until the broccoli
gets soft enough to puree a little bit
of lemon zest makes all the difference
as freshness if you have an immersion
blender this is the perfect place to use
it so you want to start out slow and
then go high you can puree this as
smooth as you like I like it to be
chunky I want some texture in there but
up to you do it the way it makes you
happy at this point you want to taste
for seasonings make sure there's enough
salt enough pepper there's not enough
lemon because I forgot to add the lemon
lemon juice I mean this soup is all
about broccoli every expression of
broccoli you must like broccoli to make
this recipe and that is it this is the
